Events.text: Roman emperor Diocletian orders the destruction of the Christian church in Nicomedia, beginning eight years of Diocletianic Persecution.
Events.html: Roman emperor Diocletian orders the destruction of the Christian church in Nicomedia, beginning eight years of Diocletianic Persecution.

Events.text: Byzantine emperor Justinian I orders the building of a new Orthodox Christian basilica in Constantinople – the Hagia Sophia.
Events.html: Byzantine emperor Justinian I orders the building of a new Orthodox Christian basilica in Constantinople – the Hagia Sophia.

Events.text: Traditional date for the publication of the Gutenberg Bible, the first Western book printed with movable type.
Events.html: Traditional date for the publication of the Gutenberg Bible, the first Western book printed with movable type.

Events.text: Mapuche forces, under the leadership of Lautaro, score a victory over the Spanish at the Battle of Marihueñu in Chile.
Events.html: Mapuche forces, under the leadership of Lautaro, score a victory over the Spanish at the Battle of Marihueñu in Chile.

Events.text: At York Castle, the outlaw Dick Turpin is identified by his former schoolteacher. Turpin had been using the name Richard Palmer.
Events.html: At York Castle, the outlaw Dick Turpin is identified by his former schoolteacher. Turpin had been using the name Richard Palmer.

Events.text: American Revolutionary War: Baron von Steuben arrives at Valley Forge, Pennsylvania to help to train the Continental Army.
Events.html: American Revolutionary War: Baron von Steuben arrives at Valley Forge, Pennsylvania to help to train the Continental Army.

Events.text: Cato Street Conspiracy: A plot to murder all the British cabinet ministers is exposed.
Events.html: Cato Street Conspiracy: A plot to murder all the British cabinet ministers is exposed.

Events.text: Texas Revolution: The Siege of the Alamo (prelude to the Battle of the Alamo) begins in San Antonio, Texas.
Events.html: Texas Revolution: The Siege of the Alamo (prelude to the Battle of the Alamo) begins in San Antonio, Texas.

Events.text: Mexican–American War: Battle of Buena Vista: In Mexico, American troops under future president General Zachary Taylor defeat Mexican General Antonio López de Santa Anna.
Events.html: Mexican–American War: Battle of Buena Vista: In Mexico, American troops under future president General Zachary Taylor defeat Mexican General Antonio López de Santa Anna.

Events.text: The official independence of the Orange Free State is declared.
Events.html: The official independence of the Orange Free State is declared.

Events.text: President-elect Abraham Lincoln arrives secretly in Washington, D.C., after the thwarting of an alleged assassination plot in Baltimore, Maryland.
Events.html: President-elect Abraham Lincoln arrives secretly in Washington, D.C., after the thwarting of an alleged assassination plot in Baltimore, Maryland.

Events.text: Reconstruction Era: Post-U.S. Civil War military control of Mississippi ends and it is readmitted to the Union.
Events.html: Reconstruction Era: Post-U.S. Civil War military control of Mississippi ends and it is readmitted to the Union.

Events.text: Alabama becomes the first U.S. state to enact an anti-trust law.
Events.html: Alabama becomes the first U.S. state to enact an anti-trust law.

Events.text: Sino-French War: French Army gains an important victory in the Battle of Đồng Đăng in the Tonkin region of Vietnam.
Events.html: Sino-French War: French Army gains an important victory in the Battle of Đồng Đăng in the Tonkin region of Vietnam.

Events.text: Charles Martin Hall produced the first samples of man-made aluminum, after several years of intensive work. He was assisted in this project by his older sister, Julia Brainerd Hall.
Events.html: Charles Martin Hall produced the first samples of man-made aluminum, after several years of intensive work. He was assisted in this project by his older sister, Julia Brainerd Hall.

Events.text: The French Riviera is hit by a large earthquake, killing around 2,000.
Events.html: The French Riviera is hit by a large earthquake, killing around 2,000.

Events.text: Émile Zola is imprisoned in France after writing "J'accuse", a letter accusing the French government of antisemitism and wrongfully imprisoning Captain Alfred Dreyfus.
Events.html: Émile Zola is imprisoned in France after writing "J'accuse", a letter accusing the French government of antisemitism and wrongfully imprisoning Captain Alfred Dreyfus.

Events.text: Second Boer War: During the Battle of the Tugela Heights, the first British attempt to take Hart's Hill fails.
Events.html: Second Boer War: During the Battle of the Tugela Heights, the first British attempt to take Hart's Hill fails.

Events.text: Cuba leases Guantánamo Bay to the United States "in perpetuity".
Events.html: Cuba leases Guantánamo Bay to the United States "in perpetuity".

Events.text: Chicago attorney Paul Harris and three other businessmen meet for lunch to form the Rotary Club, the world's first service club.
Events.html: Chicago attorney Paul Harris and three other businessmen meet for lunch to form the Rotary Club, the world's first service club.

Events.text: The AEA Silver Dart makes the first powered flight in Canada and the British Empire.
Events.html: The AEA Silver Dart makes the first powered flight in Canada and the British Empire.

Events.text: First demonstrations in Saint Petersburg, Russia. The beginning of the February Revolution (March 8 in the Gregorian calendar).
Events.html: First demonstrations in Saint Petersburg, Russia. The beginning of the February Revolution (March 8 in the Gregorian calendar).

Events.text: U.S. President Calvin Coolidge signs a bill by Congress establishing the Federal Radio Commission (later replaced by the Federal Communications Commission) which was to regulate the use of radio frequencies in the United States.
Events.html: U.S. President Calvin Coolidge signs a bill by Congress establishing the Federal Radio Commission (later replaced by the Federal Communications Commission) which was to regulate the use of radio frequencies in the United States.

Events.text: German theoretical physicist Werner Heisenberg writes a letter to fellow physicist Wolfgang Pauli, in which he describes his uncertainty principle for the first time.
Events.html: 1927 – German theoretical physicist Werner Heisenberg writes a letter to fellow physicist Wolfgang Pauli, in which he describes his uncertainty principle for the first time.

Events.text: Leopold III becomes King of Belgium.
Events.html: Leopold III becomes King of Belgium.

Events.text: Plutonium is first produced and isolated by Dr. Glenn T. Seaborg.
Events.html: Plutonium is first produced and isolated by Dr. Glenn T. Seaborg.

Events.text: World War II: Japanese submarines fire artillery shells at the coastline near Santa Barbara, California.
Events.html: World War II: Japanese submarines fire artillery shells at the coastline near Santa Barbara, California.

Events.text: A fire breaks out at Saint Joseph's Orphanage, County Cavan, Ireland, killing 35 children and one adult.
Events.html: A fire breaks out at Saint Joseph's Orphanage, County Cavan, Ireland, killing 35 children and one adult.

Events.text: Greek Resistance: The United Panhellenic Organization of Youth is founded in Greece.
Events.html: 1943 – Greek Resistance: The United Panhellenic Organization of Youth is founded in Greece.

Events.text: The Soviet Union begins the forced deportation of the Chechen and Ingush people from the North Caucasus to Central Asia.
Events.html: The Soviet Union begins the forced deportation of the Chechen and Ingush people from the North Caucasus to Central Asia.

Events.text: World War II: During the Battle of Iwo Jima, a group of United States Marines and a U.S. Navy hospital corpsman reach the top of Mount Suribachi on the island and are photographed raising the American flag.
Events.html: World War II: During the Battle of Iwo Jima, a group of United States Marines and a U.S. Navy hospital corpsman reach the top of Mount Suribachi on the island and are photographed raising the American flag.

links.title: Raising the Flag on Iwo Jima

Events.text: World War II: The 11th Airborne Division, with Filipino guerrillas, free the captives of the Los Baños internment camp.
Events.html: 1945 – World War II: The 11th Airborne Division, with Filipino guerrillas, free the captives of the Los Baños internment camp.

Events.text: World War II: The capital of the Philippines, Manila, is liberated by combined Filipino and American forces.
Events.html: 1945 – World War II: The capital of the Philippines, Manila, is liberated by combined Filipino and American forces.

Events.text: World War II: Capitulation of German garrison in Poznań. The city is liberated by Soviet and Polish forces.
Events.html: 1945 – World War II: Capitulation of German garrison in Poznań. The city is liberated by Soviet and Polish forces.

Events.text: World War II: The German town of Pforzheim is annihilated in a raid by 379 British bombers.
Events.html: 1945 – World War II: The German town of Pforzheim is annihilated in a raid by 379 British bombers.

links.title: Bombing of Pforzheim in World War II

Events.text: The first mass inoculation of children against polio with the Salk vaccine begins in Pittsburgh.
Events.html: The first mass inoculation of children against polio with the Salk vaccine begins in Pittsburgh.

Events.text: In Syria, Ba'ath Party member Salah Jadid leads an intra-party military coup that replaces the previous government of General Amin al-Hafiz, also a Baathist.
Events.html: In Syria, Ba'ath Party member Salah Jadid leads an intra-party military coup that replaces the previous government of General Amin al-Hafiz, also a Baathist.

Events.text: The Symbionese Liberation Army demands $4 million more to release kidnap victim Patty Hearst.
Events.html: The Symbionese Liberation Army demands $4 million more to release kidnap victim Patty Hearst.

Events.text: Iran hostage crisis: Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ruhollah Khomeini states that Iran's parliament will decide the fate of the American embassy hostages.
Events.html: Iran hostage crisis: Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ruhollah Khomeini states that Iran's parliament will decide the fate of the American embassy hostages.

Events.text: In Spain, Antonio Tejero attempts a coup d'état by capturing the Spanish Congress of Deputies.
Events.html: In Spain, Antonio Tejero attempts a coup d'état by capturing the Spanish Congress of Deputies.

Events.text: The United States Environmental Protection Agency announces its intent to buy out and evacuate the dioxin-contaminated community of Times Beach, Missouri.
Events.html: The United States Environmental Protection Agency announces its intent to buy out and evacuate the dioxin-contaminated community of Times Beach, Missouri.

Events.text: Supernova 1987a is seen in the Large Magellanic Cloud.
Events.html: Supernova 1987a is seen in the Large Magellanic Cloud.

Events.text: In Thailand, General Sunthorn Kongsompong leads a bloodless coup d'état, deposing Prime Minister Chatichai Choonhavan.
Events.html: 1991 – In Thailand, General Sunthorn Kongsompong leads a bloodless coup d'état, deposing Prime Minister Chatichai Choonhavan.

Events.text: In the United States, tornadoes in central Florida destroy or damage 2,600 structures and kill 42 people.
Events.html: In the United States, tornadoes in central Florida destroy or damage 2,600 structures and kill 42 people.

Events.text: Kurdish rebel leader Abdullah Öcalan is charged with treason in Ankara, Turkey.
Events.html: Kurdish rebel leader Abdullah Öcalan is charged with treason in Ankara, Turkey.

Events.text: A train derails on an evening express service near Grayrigg, Cumbria, England, killing one person and injuring 88. This results in hundreds of points being checked over the UK after a few similar accidents.
Events.html: A train derails on an evening express service near Grayrigg, Cumbria, England, killing one person and injuring 88. This results in hundreds of points being checked over the UK after a few similar accidents.

Events.text: A United States Air Force B-2 Spirit bomber crashes on Guam, marking the first operational loss of a B-2.
Events.html: A United States Air Force B-2 Spirit bomber crashes on Guam, marking the first operational loss of a B-2.

links.title: 2008 Andersen Air Force Base B-2 accident

Events.text: Unknown criminals pour more than 2.5 million liters of diesel oil and other hydrocarbons into the river Lambro, in northern Italy, sparking an environmental disaster.
Events.html: Unknown criminals pour more than 2.5 million liters of diesel oil and other hydrocarbons into the river Lambro, in northern Italy, sparking an environmental disaster.

Events.text: A series of attacks across Iraq leave at least 83 killed and more than 250 injured.
Events.html: A series of attacks across Iraq leave at least 83 killed and more than 250 injured.

Events.text: The Turkish-backed Free Syrian Army captures Al-Bab from ISIL.
Events.html: The Turkish-backed Free Syrian Army captures Al-Bab from ISIL.
